abstract.p: Paul Glatzer letter says drivers involved in any accident should be tested for alcohol use

block.p: Re ''Advocate of Moderation for Heavy Drinkers Learns Sobering Lesson'' (news article, July 9):

There is something we can do to reduce tragic accidents caused by drunken drivers. We should routinely test the alcohol levels of drivers involved in any accident. A problem drinker is likely to have several small fender-benders on the way to a major accident. In New York City at least, unless a driver is obviously inebriated, he or she isn't tested.
